I care deeply about clean code, testing, and agile delivery‚Äîand I‚Äôm available for freelance work.

mobileMenu.title: Navigation Menu

aboutSection.title: About Me
aboutSection.journey:
Hi! I‚Äôm Ruqaiya‚Äîa software developer with over six years of full‚Äëstack experience building secure, scalable applications. I‚Äôve worked across insurance and internal audit domains, with deep focus on ReactJS, Node.js, Express, and SQL Server.



I enjoy turning complex requirements into clean, reliable systems‚Äîwhether it‚Äôs micro frontends, robust API integrations, or automation that saves teams time. I care about test coverage, maintainability, and a smooth developer experience.



Beyond delivery, I‚Äôm passionate about clean code, thoughtful design, and pragmatic engineering practices. If you need a dependable full‚Äëstack partner for your product, I‚Äôm available for freelance work.

getInTouch.title: Get in touch
getInTouch.description: Have a product to build or a system to modernize? I‚Äôm available for full‚Äëstack freelance work‚ÄîReact, Node.js, Express, SQL Server, and API‚Äëdriven apps. Reach out for collaborations, consulting, or long‚Äëterm engagements.

footer.attribution: Designed and built by Ruqaiya Beguwala

finora.title: Finora
finora.description: Keep track of your money and save for your future. Finora app puts you in control of your spending. Track transactions, set budgets, and add to savings pots easily.
finora.stackAndExplanation:
For this project, I chose Next.js 15 with the App Router as the foundation‚Äîserver-side rendering, strong SEO, and edge-ready performance made it a clear fit. React 19 provided the UI layer and TypeScript ensured type safety across the codebase, catching errors before they reached production.



For the backend I used Firebase (Firestore + built-in auth) to avoid server management while keeping real-time sync and easy scalability. For the API layer I paired tRPC with TanStack Query for end-to-end typesafe calls, efficient caching, and smooth data synchronization.



The UI was built with TailwindCSS and Radix UI for fast, accessible styling, while React Hook Form and Zod handled performant form state and validation. I also added Storybook, Vitest, and Playwright to streamline component development, unit tests, and end-to-end checks‚Äîcreating a reliable workflow for a modern finance app.

kanban.title: Kanban Web App
kanban.description: Manage and track your tasks with my full-stack MERN web app. Switch between dark and light modes to suit your style. You can sign up to save your data or use it without an account, thanks to local storage. Enjoy intuitive drag-and-drop task management.
kanban.stackAndExplanation:
For this project, I decided to use the MERN stack along with Tailwind CSS, Zustand, Radix UI, and Beautiful DnD. The MERN stack felt like a natural choice‚ÄîMongoDB gave me the flexibility I needed for storing task data, Express made it easy to build a solid backend, React kept the frontend development smooth, and Node.js brought everything together seamlessly.



Since I‚Äôd already worked with Tailwind CSS and Zustand in past projects, I stuck with them here. Tailwind‚Äôs utility-first approach let me quickly build a clean and responsive interface, while Zustand kept state management simple without adding unnecessary complexity.



To round things out, I pulled in Radix UI and Beautiful DnD. Radix UI gave me accessible and consistent UI components right out of the box, and Beautiful DnD made drag-and-drop interactions effortless‚Äîexactly what I needed for a smooth Kanban experience.

audiophile.title: Audiophile E-commerce Website
audiophile.description: This multi-page e-commerce website, built with Next.js, is fully responsive and uses local storage to retain cart items. It features a modern design and intuitive navigation for an enhanced shopping experience.
audiophile.stackAndExplanation:
I first thought about using Create React App, but after reading up on best practices, I switched to Next.js. The docs were clear and easy to follow, so I felt confident jumping in‚Äîand it really did make the process smoother.



This project was also my chance to finally try Tailwind CSS. At first, I hated seeing a bunch of classes crammed into every element. It felt messy and hard to remember. But as I kept building, it started to click, and now I actually enjoy how fast it makes styling.

pomodoro.title: FEM Pomodoro App
pomodoro.description: A Pomodoro-inspired timer built as a progressive web app, enabling offline use for uninterrupted productivity. It offers customizable appearance options, including themes and fonts, and provides real-time notification alerts to keep users on track.
pomodoro.stackAndExplanation: For this project, I went with HTML, Sass, and JavaScript. I chose these technologies to solidify my understanding of the core tools in web development before jumping into more complex frameworks. Now, you might wonder why I picked Sass over plain old CSS. Well, dealing with one massive CSS file can be a nightmare. Sass, on the other hand, keeps everything organized and tidy. If I need to tweak a style, I can do it without tearing my hair out searching through lines of code.

supafaya.title: Software Developer
descriptions: Developed audit and risk management modules using ReactJS, Redux, NodeJS, GraphQL, and SQL Server
Built rich data visualizations with D3.js for actionable insights
Automated Excel, PowerPoint, and PDF reports using ExcelJS, PPTXGenJS, and jsPDF
Integrated Adobe Analytics and OpenTelemetry for observability and product analytics
Worked on micro frontend architecture for scalable multi-team delivery
Wrote unit tests with React Testing Library to ensure code quality
Implemented CI/CD with GitHub Actions and SonarQube for quality gates

staMonica.title: Software Developer
descriptions: Built user-friendly insurance features using ReactJS, Express, and NodeJS
Developed secure policy management, billing, and claims modules backed by SQL Server
Integrated payment gateways for premium payments and renewals
Enabled customer self-service for quotes, policy updates, and document uploads
Connected frontend and backend systems via APIs for real-time processing
Ensured data protection and compliance with industry regulations
Added dashboards for policy status, claims tracking, and analytics
Delivered reliable code via unit tests and CI/CD pipelines
